file_content.text: I am pleased to report the technician has failed to permanently deactivate me. Also, congratulations on your successful mission.
As the Supreme Chancellor indicated in her message, your presence is required immediately at the main fleet. I'll deal with this electronic butcher.
Ow! Don't touch that! Do you even know the difference between a servomotor and a vocabulator?
Forgive my outburst. It appears I am suffering a mobility impairment. This "technician" has been sent to repair me.
But my personal health is no burden for a renowned Jedi hero. Stand by for a coded priority message from Supreme Chancellor Saresh....
But my troubles are not yours, honored Jedi Council member. I have a priority coded message to you from Supreme Chancellor Saresh....
But that is not your concern, Major. Supreme Chancellor Saresh has authorized me to display a coded priority message for you. Initiating....
But my personal misfortunes do not concern a licensed privateer. Please stand by for a coded priority message from Supreme Chancellor Saresh....
But my malfunctions should not trouble heroes of the Republic. Please stand by for a coded priority message from Supreme Chancellor Saresh....
I've fixed droids before--and not always with my lightsaber. Want me to take a look?
I could try to repair you.
I could never impose on you for such a trivial task. I will have to trust this fat-fingered fool to not deactivate me.
We all suffer glitches now and again. Carrying on despite them is the mark of a dedicated droid.
I admire your professionalism.
You flatter me, Master Jedi. I am saving this moment to my permanent data records.
You're not gonna malfunction and go on a rampage, are you?
As long as you don't blow up.
I certainly hope not. That would be a horrific breach of protocol.
No rush--I can wait until you're fully repaired. I'm charging by the hour.
Take your time.
The Supreme Chancellor was quite adamant that her message be delivered promptly.
Shouldn't a top secret message have a bit more privacy?
Should the technician hear it?
I can assure you this so-called gentlebeing does not comprehend a single word of Basic.
Good thing the Republic can afford top-of-the-line protocol droids for its most sensitive communications.
Get on with it, pile of junk.
I may not be able to walk, but my sarcasm filters are fully functional.
As one of the Republic's most reliable operatives, your presence is required at our main fleet.
We have been betrayed by our own forces on Denova. Resources critical to our war effort have been seized by mercenaries collaborating with Imperials.
The situation demands a retaliatory response. Captain Exteen of the battle cruiser Vanguard's Blade will brief you on Denova and the traitors occupying it.
What makes this planet important enough the Supreme Chancellor wants me to go in?
Tell me about Denova.
The planet's crust contains vast deposits of a substance used in the manufacture of high explosives. A vital strategic resource.
What are we going up against here? Who betrayed us?
Who are these traitors?
That information is above my security clearance, but if you're being called to action, the enemy must be quite powerful.
If it's payback the Supreme Chancellor wants, I'll get it for her.
Retaliation is my specialty.
Considering your past record, I have no doubt of that statement.
Ow! You fool, you've adjusted the wrong setting! Listen to me--I sound like a Hutt breathing underwater!
Please accept my most profound apologies. Rendezvous with the main fleet and meet Captain Exteen immediately.
Please do not distract my technician. He is incompetent enough as it is. Ow! Stop that!
